verses.roman:
tām anādṛtya vaidarbho
duṣṭa-rājanya-coditaḥ
saṅkarṣaṇaṁ parihasan
babhāṣe kāla-coditaḥ

synonyms: tām—that (voice); anādṛtya—disregarding; vaidarbhaḥ—Rukmī, Prince of Vidarbha; duṣṭa—wicked; rājanya—by the kings; coditaḥ—urged on; saṅkarṣaṇam—to Lord Balarāma; parihasan—ridiculing; babhāṣe—he spoke; kāla—by the force of time; coditaḥ—impelled.
translation: Urged on by the wicked kings, Rukmī ignored the divine voice. In fact destiny itself was urging Rukmī on, and thus he ridiculed Lord Balarāma as follows.
